title.native: コップクラフト DRAGNET MIRAGE RELOADED

description:
The story is set in San Teresa City on the fictional Pacific island of Kariaena. The "buddy police action" series follows the detective Kei Matoba and the alternate-world knight Tirana.

15 years ago, an unknown hyperspace gate opened over the Pacific. Beyond this gate lies Reto Semaani, a strange alternate world where fairies and demons live.

San Teresa City — a city where over two million immigrants live from both worlds. As a result, there are the haves and the have-nots. Here is the world's newest "city of dreams." But in the shadow of the chaos, crime is rampant: drugs, prostitution, and weapon trafficking. The detectives who stand up to these heinous crimes are in the San Teresa City Police. When the detective Kei Matoba and the alternate-world knight Tirana — two individuals who differ in gender, personality, and even world of origin — meet, an incident erupts. Two worlds. Two justices. From this, the curtain rises on a buddy police action story!

Written by Gatoh Shoji (Full Metal Panic!) and illustrated by Range Murata.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: COP CRAFT มือปราบ 2 โลก

name.native: ティラナ・エクセディリカ
alternative: Tilarna Barsh Mirvor Imsedalya Iyeh Tebreina Devol Nelano Seiya Nel Exedilica

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/162305754) | [Website](http://gatoh.com/)

Noted as the creator of the [Full Metal Panic!](https://anilist.co/manga/40892/) franchise.

Gatou first met [Kouichi Chigira](https://anilist.co/staff/106134/), the director of Full Metal Panic's first season, by accident when he bumped into him in Shinjuku when he was late for work. The two were surprised to later meet each other at [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/)'s offices.

He has also worked as a scriptwriter on a handful of [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/)'s shows after their involvement in adapting Full Metal Panic, most notably working as the lead writer on [Hyouka](https://anilist.co/anime/12189/). He also supervised the studio's production of [Amagi Brilliant Park](https://anilist.co/anime/20602/), which was adapted from another light novel of his.

In 2019, Gatou posted controversial remarks to his Twitter about teenage environmental activist Greta Thunberg, but later removed the tweet in response to public backlash and apologized for writing it.

__Doujin Circle:__ PASTA'S ESTAB.

[Website](https://www.pseweb.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Murata_Range)

Renji "Range" Murata is a Japanese artist and designer, known for his unique style combining Art Deco and Japanese Anime elements. He is best known for his conceptual design work on [Last Exile](https://anilist.co/anime/97/Last-Exile/) and [Blue Submarine No. 6](https://anilist.co/anime/1051/Blue-Submarine-No-6/).

He began his career in the early 1990s doing design work for video games, including having done the illustrations and character design for the fighting game series made by Atlus, *Power Instinct (豪血寺一族, Goketsuji Ichizoku)*. Since 1996 he left the game company and went on to become a freelance illustrator.

He runs a doujin circle called *PASTA'S ESTAB.*, which publishes collections of illustrations from his various works as well as some original goods. He has published more than a dozen books of his work, some of the most notable being *Robot*, *Rule*, and *futurhythm*. He was also voted "Best Artist of the Year" in the 2006 Seiun Award.

Since 2013 Murata has served as a faculty member at the Kyoto Seika University's Faculty of Manga(Character Design Course). Artist [You Shiina](https://anilist.co/staff/105062/You-Shiina) is said to be among his students.

Range Murata selected an elite army of artists including [Yoshitoshi ABe](https://anilist.co/staff/96991/Yoshitoshi-ABe) and [Ugetsu Hakua](https://anilist.co/staff/102066/Ugetsu-Hakua) to contribute to *ROBOT* Volume 1 and ongoing.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Power Instinct (Arcade, 1993) (Back Designer) | (SNES, 1994) (Ending Design) *As Range
- Power Instinct 2 (Arcade, 1994) (Scroll Design) *As Range
- Tengai (SEGA Saturn, 1996) (Guest Illustrator)
- Groove on Fight: Gōketsuji Ichizoku 3 (Arcade, 1997) (Designer) *As Range
- Wachenröder (SEGA Saturn, 1998) (Main Character Design)
- Blue Submarine No. 6: Saigetsu Fumahito - Time and Tide (Dreamcast, 2000) (Character Design)
- Shin Gōketsuji Ichizoku Tōkon: Matrimelee (Arcade/Neo Geo, 2003) (Illustration)
- Spy Fiction (PlayStation 2, 2003) (Character Designer)
- Shin Gōketsuji Ichizoku: Bonnō no Kaihō (PlayStation 2, 2006) (Illustration)
- Gōketsuji Ichizoku: Senzo Kuyō (Arcade, 2009) (Illustration) !~
